2026 Headhunter Guide

PE Headhunters 2026

Seven headhunting firms control access to Blackstone, KKR, Apollo, and every top PE fund. Understanding their coverage and how to approach each is essential for 2026 on-cycle success.

Get Full Headhunter StrategyView All 7 Firms

Even "purely informational" headhunter calls are evaluative from minute one. Your profile impression sticks permanently.

The A-List vs. B-List Reality

Headhunters segment candidates into tiers that determine which funds see your profile.

A-List (Top 10-20%)

Profile: GS/MS/EVR M&A, target school, 3.8+ GPA

Access: Priority megafund slots, multiple firm options, proactive HH advocacy

B-List (Next 30-40%)

Profile: Remaining BB/EB analysts, good schools

Access: Secondary megafund positions, UMM slots, must work harder to stand out

C-List and Below

Profile: MM bank analysts, non-target backgrounds

Access: Typically not shown to megafunds. Best path is MM/LMM PE or off-cycle

Tier 1: Blue-Chip Megafund Coverage

CPI (Cromwell Partners International)

Founded: 1996

ONLY headhunter that asks paper LBO questions in initial meetings

Key Coverage

AdventHellman & FriedmanSilver LakeTHLAmerican SecuritiesNew MountainGTCRAres

Strategy: Save for last. Come prepared for technicals.

Henkel Search Partners

Founded: 2011

Consistently rated 'most pleasant to work with'

Key Coverage

KKR (all groups)CarlyleWarburg PincusVista EquityCD&RBC PartnersTPG Growth

Strategy: Prioritize this relationship. Excellent coverage + pleasant experience.

SG Partners

Founded: Early 1990s

Primary access to Blackstone main PE fund

Key Coverage

Blackstone (main PE)Sixth StreetSummit PartnersGlobal Infrastructure PartnersCrestview

Strategy: Essential for Blackstone access despite mixed reputation.

Tier 2: Strong Coverage with Specializations

Ratio Advisors

PRIMARY headhunter for growth equity

Coverage

ApolloGeneral AtlanticFrancisco PartnersCharlesbank+2 more

Essential for growth equity targeting. Strong Apollo relationship.

Amity Search Partners

Great to work with, reliable middle-market coverage

Coverage

Bain CapitalCenterbridgeTrianClearlake+1 more

Good for UMM targets and practice before Tier 1 meetings.

Dynamics Search Partners

75% hedge fund, 25% PE. Strong in Texas/energy

Coverage

Apax PartnersLeonard GreenFarallonGI Partners+1 more

Target if interested in HF crossover or Texas-based funds.

Oxbridge Group

Middle-market and hedge fund focus

Coverage

Genstar CapitalJordan CompanyGreat HillVector Capital+1 more

Essential for MM targeting. Professional but not warm.

Recommended Meeting Sequence

Don't meet with CPI first. Build up to the best coverage.

1

Week 1: Amity, Oxbridge

Practice reps, refine your story

2

Week 2: DSP, Ratio

Mid-tier coverage, continue refining

3

Week 3: Henkel, SG Partners, CPI

Save the best for last when you're sharp

Mistakes That Permanently Damage Candidacy

Headhunters have long memories. These errors follow you across cycles.

1

Reneging on a signed offer — Done with that firm and headhunter permanently

2

Lying about anything — Bank, GPA, deal involvement; PE world is small

3

Being unprepared for HH meetings — They rank you against everyone that day

4

Vague preferences ('I like everything') — Signals indecision, gets tracked

5

Leaking process information — Reputation follows you across cycles

6

Badmouthing current employer — Red flag for professionalism
